result.execSummary:
The defendant Danijel Bosnic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).

With 55 days credit.
Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but only after three years of the initial confinement has been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSD.
Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school.
Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with the Family Dollar Stores at 4331 West Oklahoma Avenue, City of Milwaukee   AND/OR   Family Dollar Store at 6015 West Forest Home Ave, City of Milwaukee,   AND/OR   Rebecca O.,   AND/OR  Andrea B.,   AND/OR   Kelly V-K,    AND/OR   Dollar Tree retail store at 5002 South 74th Street, City of Greenfield,    AND/OR   Renee D.

Follow all the rules of extended supervision.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with  55 days credit, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1.

2/24/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Danijel Bosnic in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Danijel Bosnic in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  12  years with  55  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  7 years.  

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  12  years with  55  days credit, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  7 years.  

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but only after three years of the initial confinement has been served.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Follow all the rules of extended supervision
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Obtain GED/HSD
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No firearms/ weapons
-  No Contact Order with the Family Dollar Stores at 4331 West Oklahoma Avenue, City of Milwaukee   AND/OR   Family Dollar Store at 6015 West Forest Home Ave, City of Milwaukee,   AND/OR   Rebecca O.,   AND/OR  Andrea B.,   AND/OR   Kelly V-K,    AND/OR   Dollar Tree retail store at 5002 South 74th Street, City of Greenfield,    AND/OR   Renee D.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Danijel Bosnic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Greenfield Police Report 15-295 with an incident date of 1/27/15 which will be used as a read-in on Counts 1 and 2 received and filed.

Defendant Danijel Bosnic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both counts and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on both counts as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, incidents occurring in Greenfield (Incident reports 15-125 for offense date of 1/12/2015 and incident report 15-295 for offense date of 1/27/2015) these uncharged offenses are to be used as read-ins.  State requests a Presentence Investigation Report, including the Greenfield incidents (reports attached to PSI).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danijel Bosnic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM031254  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Danijel Bosnic not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  Release for Legal (attorney contacts) and Court ONLY.

 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Danijel Bosnic not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of this hearing.   Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Defense request to address bail; state has no objection.  Defense motion to lower cash bail heard and granted by the Court.  The Court modifies (lowers) bail to $5,000 with turn over to Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring with all other conditions remaining.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
